operator.name: Octave Script Operator
operator.synopsis: Allows to execute an Octave script.
operator.help:
You can write any Octave code in the operator script.

The input exampleSets are translated either into a structure or into a cell, according to the input type parameter. Output exampleSets are translated back automatically if they are of one of the two formats.

In order to be able to call m-files, you might want to either use addpath() + any function name (recommended) in your script. Or alternatively use source() (not recommended).

It is also recommended that you clean any output variable before using it, using clean outVariableName

Additionally you may now use the <UUID> special tag in your variable names so that a unique identifier is generated at each call of the operator. This is useful when several operators use the same octave engine and manipulate the same variable names...
Two other special tags are usable : <Rapidminer_Directory> and <Current_Directory> which is the directory where the current process lies, or if it is not a file (DBrepository), a new created directory under user.home. You may for example use this directory to save variables as .mat for future work directly in octave/matlab.

Zhang, Y., and Marié, S., (2012).
